intro: Pleurospermum sikkimense, commonly known as the Sikkim pleurospermum, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are basal, lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a compact cluster. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in herbal medicine.
